intro: Oxystophyllum validipecten, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Native to coastal regions of southern Africa, this plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. The species is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate moderate drought conditions. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
